column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have PCOS.  I have been through years of trying to have a baby!  First Clomid and IUI Second time Clomid and IUI...Third time Menopur and IVF...Fourth time Follistim and IVF.  Out of everything Follistim has stimulated the most...With just the Menopur I only got 12 eggs (only 6 mature)...With Follistim I got 21 eggs!!!  It was easy to use and I had no side effects (besides completely normal hormonally emotional issues) I would say it was pretty effective but am still waiting on the blood tests for confirmed pregnancy!

column1: Ovary Follicle Stimulation for Assisted Fertility Procedures
column2: spookenfor, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I used the pen and i didn't like it.It was akward to hold and you had to make sure to write down how much you used and sometime had to do multiple injections to receive proper dosage.I would have much rather used a regular needle and vial.

column2: anonymous, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have always had irregular periods and was diagnosed with PCOS. We tried clomid first, two rounds, with no success.  Then we tried Follistim + HCG and I am now pregnant with twins. The hardest thing for me was the injections, it would really help if this was available in pill form.  Other than that there were several blood tests every week to see if my dose needed adjustment and transvaginal ultrasounds (weekly) to make sure the follicles were growing.  I think having a good doctor who will monitor you closely will make a big difference in the success of this treatment.
